summary:
The Security Council,
 Reaffirming previous resolutions on Timor-Leste, particularly resolutions 1410 (2002) and 1473 (2003),
 Commending efforts of the people and Government of Timor-Leste in developing institutions and promoting stability and human rights,
 Commending UNMISET's work in assisting the government in developing infrastructure, public administration, law enforcement, and defence capacities,
 Stressing the priority of improving the Timor-Leste police force's capabilities,
 Welcoming progress in bilateral relations between Timor-Leste and Indonesia, and encouraging continued efforts on border demarcation, security, and justice for serious crimes,
 Recognizing the need for continued efforts to transfer skills and authority from UNMISET to the government,
 Noting the planned end-date for UNMISET of 20 May 2004,
 Stressing the need for continued international support,
 Having considered the Secretary-General's report of 21 April 2003,
1. Decides to extend UNMISET's mandate until 20 May 2004;
2. Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
